explanation: The second line always adds 1 to the floor division (A // B), which is incorrect when A is an exact multiple of B. That produces an off-by-one result in those cases. I replaced that line with a correct integer ceiling-division formula (A + B - 1) // B so it only rounds up when there is a nonzero remainder.
fixed_code:
A, B = map(int, input().split())

print((A + B - 1) // B)
